parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Sets all key-value pairs in the properties object as widget properties.

description: A `DateDialog` represents a native dialog pop-up allowing the user to pick a date. Properties can only be set before open() is called. The dialog is automatically disposed when closed.

date.description: The date to be displayed in the dialog. The current date is used when no date is provided.

minDate.description: Limits the selectable date range to the given past date. No limit is applied when not set.

maxDate.description: Limits the selectable date range to the given future date. No limit is applied when not set.

[JSX.jsxFactory].description: This function is called by the framework to create JSX elements from the DateDialog class.

date.description: The selected date. Can be `null` when no date was selected.

close.description: Fired when the date dialog was closed.

date.description: The selected date. Only the date components reflect the users selection. The time component values are undefined.

select.description: Fired when a date was selected by the user.

open.description: Makes the given date dialog visible. Meant to be used with inline-JSX. In TypeScript it also casts the given JSX element from `any` to an actual DateDialog.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date to be displayed in the dialog. The current date is used when no date is provided.

open.description: Creates and opens a date dialog.
